title: BBC and Trump in a Big Fight Over a Video Edit
summary: The BBC, a big news company, is in a legal fight with former US President Donald Trump. Trump is suing the BBC for $5 billion because he says they edited his speech in a TV show called Panorama to make him look bad. In the show, they cut parts of his speech from January 6, 2021, which made it seem like he was calling for violence at the US Capitol. The BBC apologized for the edit but says they did not defame Trump and will defend themselves in court. Trump claims they cheated by changing his words. This lawsuit is happening in Florida, and the BBC has said they will not comment more while the case is ongoing. The edit caused some BBC leaders to resign after a memo criticized it.

background_read: This article is about a legal dispute between the BBC and Donald Trump. The BBC is a well-known news organization in the UK, and Trump was the US president. On January 6, 2021, Trump gave a speech before a riot at the US Capitol. The BBC made a documentary called Panorama that edited parts of his speech, which some people think made it seem like he was encouraging violence. Trump says this edit hurt his reputation, so he is suing for defamation. The BBC says they did nothing wrong and will fight the case in court. This shows how news editing can lead to big arguments and legal problems.
Article_Structure: WHO: The BBC and Donald Trump are involved in a lawsuit.
WHAT: Trump is suing the BBC for $5 billion over an edit of his speech in a Panorama documentary.
WHERE: The lawsuit is filed in Florida, USA.
WHY: Trump claims the edit defamed him by making it seem he called for violence, while the BBC defends the edit and disagrees with the claim.

perspectives.description: Trump believes the BBC cheated by editing his speech to make him look bad and is suing for defamation.
The BBC apologized for the edit but says it was not defamatory and will defend the case in court.
